Description: Deoxidised handmade bowl with slightly inverted rim and straight walls tapering to a flat base. Decorated with rouletted punctate impressions below the rim, and incised and burnished horizontal rhomboidal patterns surrounded by incised lines on the walls.Interior shows tooth-combed striations. Traces of white pigment infilling decoration.
Curator's comments: Bibliography: N. Strudwick, Masterpieces of Ancient Egypt, London 2006, pp. 66-7.
